# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Below is the Julia solution for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")  # splitting string into array of words
    result = ""             # initialize empty string to store the result
    
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word  # add word to the result string
    end
    
    return result
end
```

For your example:
```julia
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```
It will output:
```julia
"This function
will wrap
words into
lines"
```
